answers.answer: Hi,Based on your OGTT you have some mild glucose handling abnormalities(glucose intolerance) but not diabetes. It is possible that some of your symptoms are due to this rise and fall in blood sugar after you eat, in which case you should try to have small mixed meals throughout the day instead of large ones and/or carb-heavy meals.Some other common things to check include thyroid function tests and blood counts for anemias. Be sure to have a good general examination by your doctor as well as basic labwork. If you have any lightheadedness or palpitations, a holter monitor may also be useful.Stay in good contact with your doctor about this one. I am afraid I can be only of limited help given that I cannot examine you or review your medical history. But those suggestions above are a good start.As an aside, if you have any of these spells while driving please pull over immediately. No need to take an unnecessray risk.Take care.

question: Hi, I'm 39 yrs old, had gest DM 4 yrs ago, but have been OK since.  ~1 month ago developed ?gastritis and weakness.  Had colonoscopy/endoscopy and they were OK.  Have been taking Prilosec since- now weaning to 2/day from 4/day w/ my doctor's advice. All my labs were fine.  OGTT results were (fast 98, 1hr 184, 2hr 161).  Stomach feels better, but still have episodes of weakness intermittently that come over me like a wave.  It seems to happen pretty consistently after eating, especially if I haven't eaten in a while, but can also happen sort of randomly.  I've checked my blood sugar at the time its happening, but the numbers can vary so I'm not sure if that's the problem.  Any suggestions would be appreciated!  Thank you.
title: Confused and concerned
